newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico closes three ports for threatening storm.
newsitem.headline: Mexico closes three ports for threatening storm.

text.p: Mexico closed three ports to all shipping Monday and five others to movements of small vessels, as a threatening weather system whipped up high seas and winds, authorities said.

The Communications and Transportation Ministry said in a statement that the ports of Salina Cruz in the state of Oaxaca, Puerto Madero in Chiapas and Coatzacoalcos in Veracruz state had been shut by their respective port captains.

Coatzacoalcos is close to Pajaritos, one of Mexico's three major oil ports. The ministry did not say that Pajaritos was closed in its statement. Spokesmen for the state-owned oil monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) were not immediately available to comment.
A lurking weather system was causing high winds in the Gulf of Mexico and across the Tehuantepec isthmus, the ministry said. Gusts of up to 60 km per hour (37.5 mph).

It added the ports of Tecolutla, Nautla, Veracruz, Alvarado and Tlacotalpan in Veracruz state had restrictions in place for the movements of small vessels, namely fishing, tourist and recreational boats.
